p: Previous research found in literature reported rosmarinic acid levels in Ocimum basilicum L. cultivars, varied from 0.06 mg/g to 12.7 mg/g on the dried matter, with caftaric acid levels ranging from 0.002 mg/g to 0.49 mg/g [ 25]. Our results highlighted an interesting composition of O. campechianum that could be suggested as an alternative for O. basilicum, with reference to the content of rosmarinic acid.
